<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 302, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[750, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 620]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 212, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 130.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 494, 89]]<|/det|>
A grocer sells potatoes, mushrooms and carrots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 146, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 838, 121]]<|/det|>
A customer buys \(3\mathrm{kg}\) of mushrooms at \(\$ 1.04\) per kg and \(4\mathrm{kg}\) of carrots at \(\$ 1.28\) per kg.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 343, 152]]<|/det|>
Calculate the total cost.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[625, 240, 923, 259]]<|/det|>
<form>$\$  ......................................$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 241, 920, 259]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 272, 146, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 272, 707, 291]]<|/det|>
In one week, the ratio of the masses of vegetables sold by the grocer is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 303, 672, 322]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{potatoes: mushrooms: carrots} = 11:8:6.\]

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 335, 757, 353]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 489, 589, 508]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 295, 740, 314]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 311, 447, 330]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 342, 500, 361]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 373, 346, 392]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 404, 796, 424]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 420, 685, 440]]<|/det|>
